noun.description: A short glass tube with a rubber bulb at one end and a tiny hole at the other, for measuring out drops of medicine or other liquids.
examples: oils sold in bottles with a rubber-tipped dropper

noun.description: A subsidiary line or loop of filament attached to a main line or leader.

origin: Mid 17th century (in the sense a person who lets something drop); dropper (sense 1) is first recorded in the late 19th century.
